articles.author: Parul Sehgal
articles.title: Joan Didion Chronicled American Disorder With Her Own Unmistakable Style - The New York Times
articles.description: The generation-defining essayist and novelist was preoccupied with mythos — and gifted at fashioning her own.
articles.content: But can anyone lampoon her style without relying on it? To condemn the Didion narrative and all that a sentimental attachment to her obscures her mockery of early feminist organizing, for example is … [+3399 chars]
